channel.title: Distrelec Jira
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5122] SEO - MicroData Optimization
item.description:
Observations :

  • Microdata well tagged on webpages allow a very high CTR on the SERP.
  • We are using Price Microdata on our products :
  • We are not using the full set of microdata offered to us by Google :

Impacts :

  • We are not exploiting all the traffic we could gather due to lower CTR compared to the competition on our results inside the serps.

Demands :

Insert those Microdata tagging (https://developers.google.com/webmasters/richsnippets/) :

  • "Stock" Microdata type (only products pages with stock available):
    • Documentation : https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/146750
    • Code exemple for http://www.distrelec.ch/en/LED-lamp-warm-white-9-5-W-E27-Philips-COREPRO-LEDBULB-9-5-60W-E27/p/11042373 : 
      <div itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Product">
	<div itemprop="name">LED lamp warm white 9.5 W E27, COREPRO LEDBULB 9.5-60W E27, Philips</div>
	<div itemprop="offers" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Offer">
		<div itemprop="priceCurrency" content="CHF"></div>
		<div itemprop="price" content="13.90"></div>
		<link itemprop="availability" href="http://schema.org/InStock" />
	</div>
</div>
    • Code test : https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets?q=uploaded:8005036ab5453d87218f7f6fe373c989&hl=en
    • Code effect :
  • "Starting From Price" Microdata type (only Category pages)
    • Documentation : https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/146750
    • Code Exemple for https://www.distrelec.ch/en/Tools-%26-Measurement/Measuring-Instruments/Oscilloscopes/Oscilloscopes-Bench-Types/Oscilloscopes%2C-Agilent-DSO1000B/c/cat-234938 :
      A pharse saying "Price from CHF$lowest_product_price" must be added before the footer of the page and being tagged like this ($lowest_product_price="576.72") : 
      <div itemprop="offerDetails" itemscope="" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Offer-aggregate">
	Price from
	<meta itemprop="currency" content="CHF">CHF
	<meta itemprop="lowprice" content="576.72">576.72	
</div>
    • Code Exemple test : https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets?q=uploaded:800505ea66a4e0bf569562f368eac52d
    • Code effect :
  • "Breadcrumb" Microdata type (on Products and Category pages):
    • Documentation : https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/185417
    • Code exemple for http://www.distrelec.ch/en/LED-lamp-warm-white-9-5-W-E27-Philips-COREPRO-LEDBULB-9-5-60W-E27/p/11042373 :
      The breadcrumb already in place must be tagged like this : 
      <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a itemprop="url" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/c/cat-L1D_379521"><span itemprop="title">Power Supplies & Lighting</span></a>
</div>
<div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a itemprop="url" href="/http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Light-sources/c/cat-L2D_379659"><span itemprop="title">Light sources</span></a>
</div>	
<div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a itemprop="url" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Light-sources/LED-Lamps/c/cat-L3D_525567"><span itemprop="title">LED Lamps</span></a>
</div>
<div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a itemprop="url" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Light-sources/LED-Lamps/LED-lamps/c/cat-16343"><span itemprop="title">LED lamps</span></a>
</div>
<div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a itemprop="url" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Light-sources/LED-Lamps/LED-lamps/LED-Lamps%2C-E27-Socket/c/cat-348903"><span itemprop="title">LED Lamps, E27 Socket</span></a>
</div>
    • Code test : https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets?q=uploaded:8005036847c3d640f474aba15e7ff7dd&hl=en
    • Code effect :
Here is a new one, you can try it
  • "Sitelink Search Box" Microdata type (Only for the Home page):
    • Documentation : https://developers.google.com/webmasters/richsnippets/sitelinkssearch
    • Code for http://www.distrelec.ch pages html head : 
      <script type="application/ld+json">
{
	"@context": "http://schema.org",
	"@type": "WebSite",
	"url": "http://www.distrelec.ch/",
	"potentialAction": {
		"@type": "SearchAction",
		"target": "http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q={search_term_string}",
		"query-input": "required name=search_term_string"
	}
}
</script>
    • Code effect :

Checking process :

  • Copy paste of the html inside the richsnippets test plateform : http://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets (no pre-visualization = µdata wrongly implemented !)
  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.

Deprecated Demand (Don't implement it):

  • "Price" & "Stock" Microdata type (on Category pages with only one product displayed)
    • Documentation : https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/146750
    • Code Exemple for http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Tools-%26-Measurement/Measuring-Instruments/Oscilloscopes/Oscilloscopes-Bench-Types/Oscilloscopes%2C-Agilent-DSO1000B/c/cat-485635 :
      A pharse saying "Price CHF$product_price" must be added before the footer of the page and being tagged like this : 
      <div itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Product">
	<span itemprop="name">Oscilloscopes, Agilent DSO1000B
	<div itemprop="offers" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Offer">
		<span itemprop="priceCurrency" content="CHF">CHF
		<span itemprop="price" content="557.28">557.28
		<link itemprop="availability" href="http://schema.org/InStock" />In stock
	</div>
</div>
    • Code Exemple test : https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets?q=uploaded:8005036ab444381da09c62327bce7f5b&hl=en
    • Code effect :
  • "Price range" Microdata type (only on Category pages with more than one product displayed)
    • Documentation : https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/146750
    • Code Exemple for http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Light-sources/LED-Lamps/LED-lamps/LED-Lamps%2C-E27-Socket/c/cat-348903 :
      A pharse saying "Price from CHF$min_product_price to CHF$max_product_price" must be added before the footer of the page and being tagged like this : 
      <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Product">
	<span itemprop="name">LED Lamps, E27 Socket</span>
	<span itemprop="offerDetails" itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Offer-aggregate">
		Price from CHF
		<span itemprop="lowPrice">10.10</span>
		to CHF
		<span itemprop="highPrice">14.90</span>
		<meta itemprop="priceCurrency" content="CHF" />
	</span>
</div>
    • Code Exemple test : https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets?q=uploaded:8005036ab30fc481691f41d2c451ce41&hl=en
    • Code effect :

comments.comment: Please don't implement the sitelinksearch box yet, apparently it's bugged.

And just to be sure, every time I'm writing an url http://www.distrelec.ch/* it's for the exemple concerning http://www.distrelec.ch/.
If the domain is *.distrelec.de/de or *.distrelec.it it has to be inside the µdata the corresponding domain and language path.

Status update :

  • "Stock" Microdata : Ready in dev environment
  • "Starting From Price" Microdata : in finalization in dev environment
  • "Breadcrumb" Microdata : Ready in dev environment
  • "Sitelink Search Box" Microdata : Ready in dev environment

Hallo Ruben,

Could you do those Frontend stuff, which we had just discussed now please.

Please do it in a special branch which I had created for seo stuff ( https://svn.namics.com/Distrelec/Distrelec-Relaunch-2012-intern/branches/feature-sku-5122-seo_microdata)

Hello Surendra,
The FE is done.
Thanks

Thanks Ruben
done!.
Francesco Bersani | Distrelec could you merge the seo feature branch(feature-sku-5122-seo_microdata) please.
merge done, now the changes are on v3.0 branch
Hi Pierre, please test on Q

Check on Q :

  • "Stock" Microdata type : OK
  • "Breadcrumb" Microdata type : OK
  • "Starting From Price" Microdata type : NOK
    view-source:http://test.distrelec.ch/fr/Automatisation/Moteurs-Contr%C3%B4leurs-Actionneurs/Actionneurs/Electro-aimants/c/cat-357421
    <div itemprop="offerDetails" itemscope="" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Offer-aggregate">
	<meta id="currencyMeta" itemprop="currency" content="">
	<meta id="lowpriceMeta" itemprop="lowprice" content="">
</div>
    code expected
    <div itemprop="offerDetails" itemscope="" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Offer-aggregate">
	Price from
	<meta itemprop="currency" content="CHF">CHF
	<meta itemprop="lowprice" content="11">11	
</div>
  • "Sitelink Search Box" Microdata type : NOK
    view-source:http://test.distrelec.ch/
    <script type="application/ld+json">
{
   "@context": "http://schema.org",
   "@type": "WebSite",
   "url": window.location.protocol + "//" + window.location.hostname,
   "potentialAction": {
     "@type": "SearchAction",
     "target": window.location.protocol + "//" + window.location.hostname +"/search?q={search_term}",
     "query-input": "required name=search_term"
   }
}
</script>
    code expected
    <script type="application/ld+json">
{
	"@context": "http://schema.org",
	"@type": "WebSite",
	"url": "http://www.distrelec.ch/",
	"potentialAction": {
		"@type": "SearchAction",
		"target": "http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q={search_term_string}",
		"query-input": "required name=search_term_string"
	}
}
</script>

=> Not ready for deployment.

Check on Q :

  • "Stock" Microdata type : OK
  • "Breadcrumb" Microdata type : OK
  • "Starting From Price" Microdata type : OK
  • "Sitelink Search Box" Microdata type : NOK
    view-source:http://test.distrelec.ch/
    <script type="application/ld+json">
{
   "@context": "http://schema.org",
   "@type": "WebSite",
   "url": window.location.protocol + "//" + window.location.hostname,
   "potentialAction": {
     "@type": "SearchAction",
     "target": window.location.protocol + "//" + window.location.hostname +"/search?q={search_term}",
     "query-input": "required name=search_term"
   }
}
</script>
    code expected
    <script type="application/ld+json">
{
	"@context": "http://schema.org",
	"@type": "WebSite",
	"url": "http://www.distrelec.ch/",
	"potentialAction": {
		"@type": "SearchAction",
		"target": "http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q={search_term_string}",
		"query-input": "required name=search_term_string"
	}
}
</script>

=> Not ready for deployment.

Check on Production :

  • "Sitelink Search Box" Microdata type : NOK
    view-source:http://www.distrelec.ch/
    <script type="application/ld+json">
{
   "@context": "http://schema.org",
   "@type": "WebSite",
   "url": window.location.protocol + "//" + window.location.hostname,
   "potentialAction": {
     "@type": "SearchAction",
     "target": window.location.protocol + "//" + window.location.hostname +"/search?q={search_term}",
     "query-input": "required name=search_term"
   }
}
</script>
    code expected
    NOTHING, it has to be good in Q first !

=> PLEASE don't deploy stuff not validated on Q on production environment !!!

Hi Surendra
What's the status here?

@ Surendra, I reopen the tiquet there is still some issue :

  • "Breadcrumb" Microdata type : OK
  • "Starting From Price" Microdata type : OK
  • "Stock" Microdata type : NOK
    • There is conflict with tag already implemented, they need to be removed.
      Exemple :
      On P now : http://www.distrelec.ch/en/LED-lamp-warm-white-9-5-W-E27-Philips-COREPRO-LEDBULB-9-5-60W-E27/p/11042373
      lign 1449 : <div class="mod mod-product-title"><h1 class="base padding-left" itemprop="name">LED lamp warm white 9.5 W E27, COREPRO LEDBULB 9.5-60W E27, Philips</h1>
lign 1454 : <span itemprop="sku" content="254043">254043
lign 1458 : <span itemprop="mpn" content="COREPRO LEDBULB 9.5-60W E27">COREPRO LEDBULB 9.5-60W E27
lign 1486 :  <a href="#"><img itemprop="image" alt="LED lamp warm white 9.5 W E27 Buy {0}" 
lign 1511 :  <div class="gu-6" itemprop="offers" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Offer">
lign 1512 :  	<meta itemprop="priceCurrency" content="CHF" />
lign 1513 :  		<meta itemprop="price" content="17.70" />
lign 1514 :  		<meta itemprop="seller" itemtype="http://schema.org/Organization" content="Distrelec">
lign 1515 :  		<meta itemprop="itemCondition" itemtype="http://schema.org/OfferItemCondition" content="new"/>
lign 1516 :  		<meta itemprop="availability" itemtype="http://schema.org/ItemAvailability" content="in stock" />
lign 1946 : <span itemprop="brand">

      To replace with :

      Expected : http://www.distrelec.ch/en/LED-lamp-warm-white-9-5-W-E27-Philips-COREPRO-LEDBULB-9-5-60W-E27/p/11042373
      lign 1449 : <div class="mod mod-product-title"><h1 class="base padding-left">LED lamp warm white 9.5 W E27, COREPRO LEDBULB 9.5-60W E27, Philips</h1>
lign 1454 : <span>254043
lign 1458 : <span>COREPRO LEDBULB 9.5-60W E27
lign 1486 :  <a href="#"><img alt="LED lamp warm white 9.5 W E27 Buy {0}" 
lign 1511 :  <div class="gu-6">
lign 1512 :  		
lign 1513 :  			
lign 1514 :  			
lign 1515 :  			
lign 1516 :  			
lign 1946 : <span>
  • "Sitelink Search Box" Microdata type : NOK
    • To implement.

Thank you in advance.

Pierre-Francois Hubert | Distrelec
I had done the stock microdata type, which could be tested in the fixed version v3.2.m0.

Ruben Diaz Roman | Distrelec
Regarding the Sitelink search box, which is a frontend issue, so Rueben will take care of that
Front End changes done

Great news, thank you Surendra & Ruben !
When is it deployed on Q ?
Pierre-Francois Hubert | Distrelec why it is assigned to me?.
Surendra : Because I'm asking when is it deployed on Q ?

Fix Version/s:
v3.2.m0

@ Surendra, I reopen the tiquet there is still issues :

  • "Stock" Microdata type : NOK
    • There is conflict with tag already implemented, they need to be removed.
      The suppression of the old tag requested here http://jira.distrelec.com/browse/DISTRELEC-5122?focusedCommentId=34755&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-34755
      is not on Q. (validated with http://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets)
  • "Sitelink Search Box" Microdata type : NOK
    Exemple :
    On Q now : http://test.distrelec.ch
        <script type="application/ld+json">
            {
               "@context": "http://schema.org",
               "@type": "WebSite",
               "url": "http://www.distrelec.ch" ,
               "potentialAction": {
                 "@type": "SearchAction",
                 "target": "http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q={search_term}",
                 "query-input": "required name=search_term"
               }
            }
        </script>

    To replace with :

    Expected : http://test.distrelec.ch
    <script type="application/ld+json">
{
    "@context": "http://schema.org",
    "@type": "WebSite",
    "url": "http://www.distrelec.ch/",
    "potentialAction": {
        "@type": "SearchAction",
        "target": "http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q={search_term_string}",
        "query-input": "required name=search_term_string"
    }
}
</script>

    Diff : http://www.diffnow.com/?report=8eunz

Thank you in advance.

Pierre-Francois Hubert | Distrelec There is something went wrong. May be due to SVN migration. We should check this("Stock" Microdata type) in next deployment.
Ruben Diaz Roman | Distrelec Could you take care of "Sitelink Search Box" Microdata typ. because you have did this
FE work done and commited
Pierre, Please test on Q if possible, thx.

• "Stock" Microdata type : NOK on Q
    • There is conflict with tag already implemented, they need to be removed.
      The suppression of the old tag requested here http://jira.distrelec.com/browse/DISTRELEC-5122?focusedCommentId=34755&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-34755
      is not on Q. (validated with http://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets)
  • "Sitelink Search Box" Microdata type : OK on Q

Thank you in advance.

Need to be controlled why such things happened. I see in my local development perfect., but not in q and p.
Waiting for Francesco Bersani | Distrelec and Nabil Benothman | Distrelec

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6406] Text change upon all search-category-selection
item.description:
If all categories are selected manually(1.), then hitting the "All"-Category, which deselects all others (2.) and then another text appears below the Login/Register(3. - MyAccount-Button).

This text shouldn't appear (3.). Please fix.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Please test,
Thanks!

attachment.name: 2015-02-16 10_12_06-Distrelec Suisse _ Meilleur Online Shop pour l'Electronique.png
attachment.author: rburlet

attachment.name: 2015-02-16 10_13_46-Distrelec Suisse _ Meilleur Online Shop pour l'Electronique.png
attachment.author: rburlet

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6390] Import Tool // Wrong Table Header on Resultpage
item.description: After importing my file including quantity, references and Distrelec product number the structure of the table is different on the not matching result list.
item.summary: Import Tool // Wrong Table Header on Resultpage

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Please test after the next deployment
Thanks

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6353] Change text on buttons
item.description:
Could you please modify the following texts?

Category Selection: Select Category
1. Change font size from 16px to 14px
2. Add a newline
3. Rename to:
Select search
category

My Account Button:

  • If I'm logged out the text should be:
    Login/
    Registration
  • If I'm logged in the text should be:
    My Account
    Firstname Lastname

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Searchfield:
1. Define only the word "search" as bold

This has a technical limitation regarding partial styling in placeholders of HTML input elements: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/22655493/how-can-i-style-individual-parts-of-an-input-placeholder

There is a workaround, but I would need the word "Search" separated for every language.
Okay, then let's keep it as it is for the search term.
Okey, then please test the rest of points in the next deployment.

Hi Ruben,
I still see the text on the my account button: My Account <newline> Login or Register.
It should be:

  • If I'm logged out the text should be:
    Login/<newline>Registration
  • If I'm logged in the text should be:
    My Account<newline>Firstname Lastname
changed
perfect
Tested OK in Q

Hi Ruben,
The customer name is too long now. (Screenshot)

To be tested after the next deployment
thanks

attachment.name: 2015-02-13 11_58_47-Distrelec Schweiz _ Bester Online Shop für Elektronik.jpg
attachment.author: fbuehler

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6341] Auto-apply filter
item.description:
Rename to “Auto-update results”

Include information layer next to it “Tick the box if you would like to automatically update the search results as soon as a filter is selected” (see screenshot)

Laura will check for translations with Sam.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Please test after the next deployment
Thanks

Hi Daniela
Part 1 is done.
I would like to discuss about the new position of the other icons.
Could you please test part 1?

Hi Laura

Can you please check this?

Thanks.
/Daniela

Hi Florian

I checked Part 1, print icon only appears if the mouse is over the information icon, please see the screenshots attached, please fix it.
Question: once I have the translations of "Auto-update filter" and we know the length for each language; could we move closer the info icon to the text it is referring to, if possible?
Thank you,
Laura

Fixed.
I have also moved the icon a little bit more to the left.
Note in case of long text, we will have the ellipsis (...)

Please test after today's deployment
thanks!

Tested OK in Q.
But I will add a little cosmetic change.
Please find attached all the translations

Please test after the next deployment
thanks

Hi,
For the languages which are longer, please write 2 lines so that the full name can be read instead of ".." (see dirty mock-up as example)
Thanks,
Laura

No, I don't think we need two lines there in order to not spoil the screen with more text. In my opinion the functionality is clear as well with the "...". For more details(Use-case: if it's unclear to the customer) the customer can mouse-over the info-button. If you still think this needs to be changed, please create a new ticket for this, thanks.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6236] Forward/backward buttons on top of hero teasers
item.description:
The idea is to be able to go forward or backward in the hero teasers manually without stopping the rotation.

The buttons should only appear once the mouse is moving over the hero teaser component (v1  v2). When the mouse is moved over a button itself the colour of the shape changes and the forward or backward movement starts with a click on it (v3).
item.summary: Forward/backward buttons on top of hero teasers

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Hi Marc,
We'll use our common arrow icons including the specific colours --> Screenshot
Okay?

Hi Florian,
Please use attached png files instead.
Thanks

Please test after the next deployment
thanks

Hi Ruben
As discussed a small change in position of the two buttons is still required. Please center them between the two grey boundary lines of the hero teasers and right- or left-align them precisely on the hero area.
Thx, Marc

Adjusted!
Please re-test
Thanks
Everything's fine now! thx

Hi Ruben
As discussed.
The arrows should be on a fix position. At the moment the position changes aligned to the browser window size.

Done!
Please re-test

Now the arrows are not centered looking at the vertical position!
And when you mouse-over the hero teasers, the whole carpet gets shifted down!
Can you please fix this?
Hope this is the last one
Needs testing after 3.2.1 deployment.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6210] HU, CZ, SK, RO (P) // Key - thank you message after Quote request was sent, is in German
item.description:
Please change the than you text that appears after a Quote Request Form was filled in, in webshop HU:

HU:

„Köszönjük szépen !

Köszönjük a visszajelzését ! Az esetet kivizsgáljuk
És rövidesen felvesszük Önnel a kapcsolatot.”

RO:

Vă mulţumim!

Multe mulţumiri pentru comunicarea dvs!
Vom clarifica situaţia şi vom lua contact cu dvs cît mai repede posibil.

CZ:

Ďekujeme

Děkujeme Vám za poptávku.
Prověříme možnosti a co nejdříve se s Vámi zkontaktujeme

SK:

Ďakujeme

Ďakujeme Vám za dopyt.
Preveríme možnosti a čo najskôr sa s Vami skontaktujeme

-------------------------------------------------------------------------
[Created via e-mail received from: "Szuchomelli, Peter" <peter.szuchomelli@distrelec.com>]
item.summary: HU, CZ, SK, RO (P) // Key - thank you message after Quote request was sent, is in German

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: fixed
not testable as I didn't found a product with the feature activated.
Why is it assigned to you?
Added translation for RO, CZ, SK. Please integrate.

Please add also the text for LT.
EN: Thank you for your message. We will check the case and contact you as soon as possible.

LT:

Ačiū!

Dėkojame už Jūsų žinutę. Mes patikrinsime šį atvejį ir susisieksime su Jums kaip įmanoma greičiau.
fixed

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6163] LT - Ship to different address function
item.description:
The ability to ship to addresses different than the billing-address should be activated for Lithuania.

Requestor: Peteris Sprogis
item.summary: LT - Ship to different address function

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Hi Rafael,

I looked into the code and found at the moment there is check that restricts only B2B customers from adding shipping address. Does that means this check should be removed completely ? Let me know if there is still some condition where this restriction should be applied. Thanks
According to Peteris: Please remove the restriction for B2B and put them in place for B2C.
The required changes are done and it is ready for testing after next deployment in q system.

Hi Rafael,

Just realised during testing that changes are required on front end as well to enable the Shipment option to another address in case of b2b customer.
Back end changes are done to allow b2b customer to add another Shipment address. Assigning the required front-end Changes to Ruben.

Problems in SAP for Lithuania in Q

16 Jan 2015 15:06:25 WARN [hybrisHTTP43] [AddToCartController] Couldn't add product of code 14021771 to cart 000045OW.
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cart model 000045OW was not calculated due to: Could not get order simulation from SAP PI

Hi Ruben,

There is some problem with the products in Lithuania webshop in Q. Hence you can't add all products into the basket. Please use the following list of product if you want to test something :-

4831764
4831772
4831780

Hello Neeraj,

I can't add any of these products to the cart on test.distrelec.lt

Could you please have a look?
Thanks

Please test after the next deployment
Thanks
Testing blocked by: DISTRELEC-6260

Following issues:

  1. Add new shipping address button missing in checkout.
  2. When adding a new shipping address out of MyAccount then the address is not saved after filling the form and hitting save.

Hi Rafael,

Point number 2 is resolved and can be test after next release.
Button will be hidden for ELFA B2C users

1. Point 1 still open: In case of B2B user, the button to add a new address in the checkout is missing.
  2. I confirm Point 2. is solved.

Rafael Burlet | Distrelec, I think this will be present in the next deployment.

I have changed the fix version.
Thanks
Hi Ruben, the button is now present but does not have any effect on Q.

Neeraj Shandilya | Distrelec and me have tested the button, and apparently it works fine in Test in his computer.

But there is a weird problem. In my computer I'm not able to add any product to the cart.
I have also tried to import the products by PIM, but I have the same problem.

Not all the products on Q are from SAP activated for LT. This product works: 4831772
I just verified the button to be working now with v3.2.3.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6214] Missing decoding for reserved characters in FF
item.description:
The reserved FF-characters |, # and = suddenly miss the decoding when displayed in the shop.

I.e. they will appear as %7C, %23 and %3D in the facets and the SERP-listings, which makes them almost impossible to understand for our customers.

Please put the decoding in place again.
item.summary: Missing decoding for reserved characters in FF

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

comments.comment: Please check with Nabil regarding the Embedded modification.

Hi Daniela,

There is a UTF-8 problem from the FACT-Finder side. We cant do anything from our side.
We should report to FACT_Finder team.

Hi Surendra

FF cannot handle UTF-8. That's a known fact and this is why we have issues with special characters (other than "just" the reserved ones). I checked with the FF technical consultant and he said that these characters have to be sent encoded to FF, which processes it like this and the shop will have to decode these characters again.

Hope this helps.

/Daniela

Hi Daniela,
Fixed. Please review in the next deployed version v3.2.m5.
